DataElement.preferredName: Endoscopic Laboratory Procedure Negation Whole Squamocolumnar Junction Performed Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the reason the entire squamocolumnar junction (SCJ) was not assessed or visualized.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Endoscopic Laboratory Procedure Negation Whole Squamocolumnar Junction Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a complete (constituting the full quantity or extent) squamocolumnar junction (the upper portion of the anus or that part that connects to the rectum) endoscopic procedure (a procedure that uses an endoscope to examine the inside of the body) not performed (carried out).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (en-DAHS-ko-pee) The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.:The border between the squamous epithelium that lines the ectocervix and the columnar epithelium that lines the endocervix.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The border between the squamous epithelium that lines the ectocervix and the columnar epithelium that lines the endocervix.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
